comment: Professor Khazaei is a very nice guy but not so great of a teacher, he does not prepare you well for the tests and quizzes and only reads off pdf files and practice problems for teaching. If you want to do well, you are going to have to teach yourself the material to really learn it.

You can teach yourself this material faster than Professor Ali can teach it. Very bland and boring class writes on a whiteboard the whole class and he makes it semi difficult to learn and follow. He sometimes gives out quizzes, but I have yet to receive any grade on most of them. Very easy grader but in the end it's not enough to help.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: EE 6120: Easy A. Could've gotten a higher grade if I just didn't miss assignments. I was a bit intimidated by this course but you can get all answers from Chegg. He is an easy grader. There's a lot of HW & there's 3 Test. I would definitely retake him. My only issue is he grades a bit slow & has little effort in communication.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I watched Regular show everyday in his class and passed with an A. TAKE HIM !!!!!!
Best professor at kennesaw easily.

lectures by only writing on the whiteboard but he puts versions of what he writes onto d2l. had a good amount of homework, had a few quizzes, and had three exams(one was on the week before finals which was not fun.) he curved things based on need, and doesn't use d2l for grades so keep the graded papers he gives back if you want to know

Took him for Dynamics in the summer. He is a good professor and is very knowledgeable. We did about 12 homework, 2 quizzes, 3 tests and a final. Everything is on chegg. He curves grades heavily and it is not hard to get an A compared to other engineering courses. I did learn too so it was worth it and I would take him again.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Look, this is a free A, but I could not tell you one thing about thermo. Never did a discussion post and submitted the same file for every HW and he never graded them. Chegged the tests easy A. His lectures are not helpful for learning just reads off PDFs, choose someone who actually teaches unless you just want the free A.

I took Professor Khazaei's online Thermodynamics class. Going into the semester I was told all of the horror stories about how difficult thermodynamics could be, but I was pleasantly surprised by how manageable the course material was. The information provided for you by him will ensure your success. I managed an A and so can you all.

Very knowledgeable about topic. Started out with a few quizzes that vanished in semester. Very lenient on grading and curving materials and giving extra credit. Lectures on things that are needed, will take this professor again if possible.

I have heard this professor is good in person. DO NOT take him online. He clearly had no idea what he was doing or what asynchronous means. He tried to find a specific 2 hour window where 30 college students taking an asynchronous online course would all have free to take a test. He ultimately failed and had weird test structure because of it.

Very helpful lectures. He also is willing to curve tests if need be. Thermodynamics is not an easy class and you will need to attend class and pay attention to the lectures to pass. He is available for office hours if you have any questions and is willing to work with you. Definitely would take again
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Easiest Professor taken so far. It likes he gives out free A's on everything from tests, quizzes, and hw. Minimum effort required. The only thing he is bad at uploading grades. Nice professor, powerpoints easy to follow

It's a double-edged sword; you will not learn anything in his class but, you will get an easy A. If you're taking a class where you need to retain the information to do well in more advanced courses, take someone else. If you just need to get by, you'll love him. However, I had him for Thermo, so I am terrified about moving on to Heat Transfer.

Not a tough grader at all, you almost have to try to score lower than an 80 on a test or quiz. Homework is mandatory but all of the answers are easy to find online if you were so inclined. He curves almost everything and is really understanding when it comes to late work or changing grades (if it was graded wrong).
He has no personality lol (I don't mean that in a bad way). If you put in moderate effort he will give you opportunities to retake a test. He is a solid choice.

I was scared at first when looking at the reviews here but it was a good professor. The homework is optional but it helps you to understand the topic and they are not really hard, there are 4 tests (3 in class, 1 final cumulative). Takes attendance every class, and he is generous with grading
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: His lectures are FAST paced. When working on problems he skips steps that he assumes you intuitively know. You will spend more energy writing down what's on the board, than paying attention to him, so the key to pass is independent study. Also, don't sit on the front row, as he does not use deodorant. Lots of hw and quizzes. He is nice though.

I took the class online (would not recommended). He was hard to get in touch with through email. He also took a long time to grade things (didn't have 2nd test graded before we took test 3). I heard his lecture class was much better. He does want you to learn and pass his class though, so things aren't too difficult. Would take him again in person.

attend all the lectures, take  notes, all the example problems he does in class. Tests are open book and notes. Easiest final exam. Exams question are from Example problems done in class. so TAKE NOTE.

Khazaei is a good professor. He's the only person teaching classes for the HVAC/energy specialization. He does a good job relating the courses he teaches to each other. He definitely has a laid back attitude which can deceive students on the difficulty of his tests. Do and understand the homework and you'll get an A.
had him for thermo and dynamics. kind of has emotionless attitude, but he shows every single step of a problem, knows his stuff well.
Took Thermo with him. Not that hard. He assigns take home quizzes worth a lot of points. Do homework=do well on tests.

Awful. When you asked him a question he would answer a different one not related to the one you asked. Handwriting is hard to read. Doesn't make symbols that are similar, like U and V, distinguishable. When working problems he writes a bunch of numbers on the board and says "there's the answer". Strongly advise against taking at all cost.
No Comments
